0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Otitis externa: initial, insert saturated wick of cotton into the ear canal; leave for at least 24 h and keep moist by adding 3 to 5 drops every 4 to 6 h
  • Otitis externa: maintenance, instill 5 drops OTICALLY 3 to 4 times daily, for as long as indicated
  • Vaginal pH imbalance: 1 applicatorful INTRAVAGINALLY in the morning and evening; duration determined by patient's response to therapy

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy have not been established in children below 3 years of age
  • Otitis externa: (3 y and older) initial, insert saturated wick of cotton into the ear canal; leave for at least 24 h and keep moist by adding 3 to 5 drops every 4 to 6 h
  • Otitis externa: (3 y and older) maintenance, instill 3 to 4 drops OTICALLY 3 to 4 times daily, for as long as indicated

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Otitis externa
  • Vaginal pH imbalance
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Diagnostic procedure

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• herpes simplex, vaccinia and varicella (steroid-containing otic solution)
  • hypersensitivity to acetic acid products
  • perforated tympanic membranes (otic solution)

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• discontinue if sensitization or irritation occurs (otic solution)
  • transient stinging or burning may be noted when solution is first instilled into acutely inflamed ear (otic solution)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• Irrigation
    • (transurethral) not for injection; for irrigation only
    • (transurethral) for continuous or intermittent irrigation, administer by gravity drip; use an administration set connected to an indwelling urethral catheter designed for continuous or intermittent 2-way flow
    • (transurethral) for continuous or intermittent irrigation, adjust drip rate to maintain a urinary effluent pH of 4.5 to 5
    • (transurethral) for periodic irrigation, use a bulb or piston syringe
  • Otic
    saturate wick and insert in ear; keep moist and leave in place for at least 24 h

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• (vaginal jelly) vaginal acidity
  • (otic solution) symptomatic improvement
  • (irrigation) urinary pH; four times daily during administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause a burning/stinging sensation.
  • Instruct patient on proper instillation technique of otic solution.
